abstract: President Tsai can thank Beijing for its stupidity if she stays in power.
lead_paragraph: This Saturday, voters in Taiwan will choose their next president and the national Legislature. Tsai Ing-wen, the incumbent president who is detested by the Chinese government because of her tough — if, until recently, low-key — anti-China stance, has chosen as her running mate William Lai Ching-Te, who openly promotes independence for Taiwan. That was a risky move, and it may well help her chances.
keywords: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
